Check the signal strength for your DTT channels. While checking the signal strength any DVR recordings in progress will be stopped and scheduled recordings will not begin. DVR recording will resume when you are done.

Recent channel list has been cleared.
To cancel, press the STOP button
Add a new RF remote (Step 1 of 2)
Add a new RF remote (Step 2 of 2)

Unexpected screen or channel changes may be caused by RF remotes in neighboring homes. The following screens step you through programming your RF remote and TV receiver to fix this problem. Choose Next to continue.
Your RF remote control has a green label with the letters 'RF' at the bottom. Once you have your RF remote in hand, choose Next.
Put your remote in program mode.
To put your remote in programming mode, - first hold the AT&T button down, - then press the OK button:
- release both buttons at the same time. You will see 4 buttons at the top of your remote flash twice.
Input your new RF remote code.
- Press these numbers on your remote:
Input your new RF remote code.
- Now press these numbers on your remote:
You have successfully programmed your RF remote control and TV receiver. If you have more RF remotes that need programming, choose Add new remote.
No changes have been made to your RF remote. If your remote is not working, use the arrow buttons on the TV receiver to go to Add a new remote under Television settings.
The following screens step you through the process of adding a new RF remote. Choose Next to continue.
Identify your new RF remote control.
Your new RF remote control has a green label with the letters 'RF' at the bottom, and does not currently work with the TV receiver. Choose Next to continue.
1. Pick up your new RF remote. 2. Hold the AT&T button down, then press the OK button. 3. Release both at the same time. The remote will flash. 4. Press these numbers on your remote:
5. Wait 3 seconds, then press these numbers:
6. Wait 3 seconds, then press ENTER. 7. Wait 3 seconds, then press ENTER again. 8. Wait 3 seconds, then press OK.
You have successfully programmed a new RF remote control for your TV receiver.
Your new RF remote has not been programmed to work with your TV receiver.

Your TV may not be able to display {Mode}. To verify if this is the correct setting for your TV, choose Start test. If you don't see anything during the test, wait 15 seconds and then choose another setting.
If you can see this screen, your TV can display {Mode}. Please select Keep setting to confirm. This test will end in {Countdown} seconds.

If you saw a black screen during the test, your TV may not be able to display high definition video, or your TV may not be properly connected to your set-top box. Choose another setting or check your cables to make sure your HDTV is connected properly. If you saw an image during the test, choose Start test again.
I saw a black screen. Choose another setting.

Closed captions are displayed using one of the eight predefined font styles. For each font style the user has an option of assigning the preferred font to that particular style. Which style will be used is defined by the captions provider, and in most cases that will be Font 1.

Video On Demand lets you watch a wide range of movies and TV shows whenever you want. You can pause, rewind, fast-forward, and even leave a video to continue watching later. Video choices change frequently, so you can always find something new to watch. You have no current rentals. Press the right arrow on your remote to browse videos available.

Music|object.container|1|Browse all of your music. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.

Music by Album|object.container.album.musicAlbum|7|Browse your music by album. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.
Music by Artist|*|6|Browse your music by artist. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.

Music by Playlist|music.container.playlistContainer|F|Browse music playlists that you created with Windows Media Player. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.
Photos|object.container.album.photoAlbum|3|Browse all of your photos. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.

Photos by Folder|object.container.album.photoAlbum|16|Browse your photos by folder. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.

Photos by Date Taken|object.container.album.photoAlbum|C|Browse your photos by a specific date. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.

Photos by Keyword|object.container.album.photoAlbum|D2|Browse your photos by keywords. After playing your music, use the Back button to add photos to your slideshow. Use the Menu button to clear your slideshow.

The TV receiver is connected to the network but is unable to interact with the Internet connection device.
The TV receiver is not physically connected to the network with an Ethernet cable. Please verify that an Ethernet cable is connected.
An internal device failure is preventing network access. Try restarting the TV receiver. You may need to replace the TV receiver.

The TV receiver is not able to obtain an IP address. Please ensure that your Internet connection device is online, and that either DHCP is enabled on it, or the TV receiver is manually assigned a static IP address.

The TV receiver cannot obtain internet connectivity. First try restarting the TV receiver by choosing Restart. If after choosing Restart, the TV receiver still cannot connect, try unplugging the Internet connection device, plugging it back in and choosing Try again.

The TV receiver is unable to access an Internet connection device. Please ensure that your Internet connection device is online, and that either DHCP is enabled on it, or the TV receiver is manually assigned a static IP address.

The TV receiver is not physically connected with an Ethernet cable or the Internet connection device is powered off. Please verify that an Ethernet cable is connected and that the Internet connection device is powered on.

The TV receiver was unable to get a DHCP address from the Internet connection device. Please ensure that the Internet connection device has DHCP enabled and choose Try again, or manually set a static IP address.
The TV receiver was able to get an IP address, but was unable to access the Internet. Please check your Internet connection device’s Internet connection and choose Try again.
The TV receiver was able to connect to the Internet connection device, but could not find a DNS server address. Please try again later.

The TV Receiver was able to connect to the Internet connection device, but was unable to connect to the DNS server. Please verify that the Internet connection device is physically connected to the Internet and choose Try again.
